content: Most of your tips are spot on, but I am not fully sure about the “connect with people that you don’t know”. I would agree with that if that means that you intend to actually want to have an actual connection with that person — whether that’s professional or otherwise. LinkedIn is called a “social network” for a reason — it’s intended to provide its members that social glue and its members should take full advantage of it. If you are in my LI network this means that you should respect me enough to have a bi-directional conversation when I reach out to you at the very least. Don’t reach out to me to connect just to add my name to your list of connections. If you want to keep track of what I am up to, follow me — I have no problem with that.
